vo-dml:model.name: Phot
vo-dml:model.description: Data model describing Photometric properties for data sets to be used for data calibration, comparison or reprocessing.
vo-dml:model.title: PhotDM
vo-dml:model.author: Jesús Salgado, Carlos Rodrigo, Pedro Osuna, Mark Allen, Mireille Louys, Jonathan McDowell, Deborah Baines, Jesús Maíz Apellániz, Evanthia Hatziminaoglou, Sebastien Derriere, Gerard Lemson

primitiveType.name: UCD
primitiveType.description: Specialized string type derived from ivoa:string. UCD words belong to a controlled vocabulary. They are used as semantics tags for the content of table columns . See the UCD IVOA Recommendation.

primitiveType.name: ISOTime
primitiveType.description:
Time stamp, represented as a string. This representaion is compliant to the DALI time stamp definition : section 3.3.3 Timestamp in https://www.ivoa.net/documents/DALI/20170517/REC-DALI-1.1.pdf This class derives from the ivoa:datetime class.
It could be inserted in the ivoa: template data model for types in a next version.

enumeration.name: TypeOfMagSystem
enumeration.description: The type of System used to compute magnitude for this photometric calibration procedure .

objectType.name: PhotometricSystem
objectType.description: The reference photometric system used to interpret photometric measurements.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: This string contains a human readable short-text representation of the photometric system. This will allow client applications to display textual information to final users.

attribute.name: detectorType
attribute.description: Detector type associated to this photometric system. Possible values are: 0 for Energy counter (amplifiers), 1 for Photon counter (CCDs, Photomultipliers).

composition.name: photometryFilter
composition.description: The Photometric information is related to a Photometric system, and gathers filter descriptions, for one or several .

objectType.name: PhotometryFilter
objectType.description: Filter class to store ids, name and properties.

attribute.name: fpsIdentifier
attribute.description: IVOA identifier of the filter profile service where this photometry filter is registered to be used in the discovery of all the relevant photometry filter properties.

attribute.name: identifier
attribute.description: This field identifies a filter, in a unique way, within a certain Photometry Filter Profile service. Example to build this string : Facility/Subcategory/Band[/Suffix] like SDSS/SDSS.G/G

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: A human readable string to represent the filter name.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: This string contains a verbose human readable label for the filter. This will allow client applications to display textual information to final users.

attribute.name: bandName
attribute.description: A standard label representing the spectral band associated to this filter (if any).

attribute.name: dateValidityFrom
attribute.description: Start time of the time coverage for which this filter configuration is applicable. String time format accepted is ISO8601.

attribute.name: dateValidityTo
attribute.description: End time of the time coverage for which this filter configuration is applicable. String time format accepted is ISO8601.

composition.name: bandwidth
composition.description: Association to the spectral band-pass of the Filter.

composition.name: transmissionCurve
composition.description: Link to the Transmission Curve of the Filter, when this is described.

composition.name: spectralLocation
composition.description: Association to a spectral coordinate value for locating the Filter band-pass. Usually the mean value.

objectType.name: PhotCal
objectType.description: A class to bind together all photometic calibration reference information: a photometry filter, a certain magnitude system configuration and a certain zero point object.

attribute.name: identifier
attribute.description: A unique identifier of the Photometry calibration instance within the project and a filterprofile service . Suggested syntax would be: Facility/Subcategory/Band/Photometric System Type[/Suffix]

composition.name: zeroPoint
composition.description: The ZeroPoint value for the flux to mag translation belongs to a Photcal element and is defined for one Filter element and one MagnitudeSystem .

composition.name: magnitudeSystem
composition.description: ZeroPoint values are given with one computation method corresponding to a defined Magnitude system.

reference.name: photometryFilter
reference.description: Each PhotCal element is related to one single Filter. Some Filter object may have no calibration registered yet.

objectType.name: ZeroPoint
objectType.description: This class is used to characterize a zero point flux obtained during the calibration of a certain photometry filter on a certain photometric system configuration.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type describing the way the zeropoint value is defined . Is an integer value : {0=Pogson, 1=Asinh, 2=Linear} corresponding to zero point definitions.

attribute.name: referenceMagnitudeValue
attribute.description: Reference magnitude value of the calibrating object. can be a implemented as a double number to get the maximum precision. Default value is zero, but sometimes the reference mag measured is slightly above.

attribute.name: referenceMagnitudeError
attribute.description: Total error estimated on the reference magnitude value whenever applicable.

composition.name: flux
composition.description: Points to the flux value associated to this ZeroPoint magnitude.

objectType.name: PogsonZeropoint
objectType.description: Extension of ZeroPoint to accommodate standard logarithm magnitudes. It has no supplementary attributes but specific conversion functions.

objectType.name: AsinhZeropoint
objectType.description: Extension of ZeroPoint to describe asinh magnitudes, a.k.a. luptitudes.

attribute.name: softeningParameter
attribute.description: Parameter used to correct the calculation of magnitudes for faint sources. Usually called 'b'. See (Lupton and Gunn et al. [1999]) for a formal explanation.

objectType.name: LinearFluxZeropoint
objectType.description: Extension of ZeroPoint to describe simple linear flux photometry, commonly used in Radio, Far Infrared and X-ray spectral ranges. Although not being magnitudes as such, relative linear flux measurements can be included as a special and trivial case of magnitude.

objectType.name: MagnitudeSystem
objectType.description: A class to describe the Magnitude System used , its type and the reference spectrum attached if present.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of magnitude system used to compute the associated zeropoint . Typical values are : VEGAmag, ABmag, STmag .

attribute.name: referenceSpectrum
attribute.description: Link to the reference spectrum as a URI.

objectType.name: Bandwidth
objectType.description: This class is used to characterize the spectral properties of a filter.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: Unified Content Description (UCD) string that specifies the nature of the bandwidth object.

attribute.name: unitexpression
attribute.description: Unit string that specifies the spectral unit for this filter.

attribute.name: extent
attribute.description: Bandwidth’s extent of the filter , as length of the covered spectral interval , or effective width following appropriate filter type.

attribute.name: start
attribute.description: In practice, this could be taken as the minimum value of the filter transmission curve.

attribute.name: stop
attribute.description: In practice, this could be taken as the maximum value of the filter transmission curve.

objectType.name: TransmissionPoint
objectType.description: This class is used to represent a point in the transmission function of a Filter.

attribute.name: transmissionValue
attribute.description: Transmitted value for the filter at this point of the transmission curve. Usually between 0 and 1.

attribute.name: spectralValue
attribute.description: Spectral coordinate value for the transmission point.

attribute.name: spectralErrorValue
attribute.description: Error on the spectral coordinate value for the transmission point.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: Unified Content Description (UCD) string that specifies the nature of the spectral axis in the transmission curve.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: Unit string that specifies the spectral unit for this filter.

objectType.name: Access
objectType.description: Gathers all properties to access a resource : uri, format and size .

attribute.name: reference
attribute.description: URI to access the resource.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Approximate estimated size of the dataset, specified in kilobytes.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: Format of the accessed resource. Typically a MIME type is used : application/fits, application/x-votable+xml, text/csv, text/xml, etc.

objectType.name: TransmissionCurve
objectType.description: A collection of points along the spectral axis to indicate how flux are transmitted by a filter. The transmission profile can be described by an external file and accessed through the Access instance, or can be stored as a collection of transmission points stored together in the PhotometryFilter serialized instance.

composition.name: transmissionPoint
composition.description: Set of points of the transmission curve.

composition.name: access
composition.description: Access to an external file containing the set of Transmission Points.

objectType.name: SpectralLocation
objectType.description: A spectral coordinate value for locating the Filter band-pass. Usually the mean value (for instance in wavelength units). This class is used to characterize the spectral properties of a filter.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: Unified Content Description (UCD) string that specifies the nature of the spectral location for this filter.

attribute.name: unitexpression
attribute.description: Unit string that specifies the spectral units for this filter.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: A spectral coordinate value that can be considered by the data provider as the most representative for this specific filter bandpass. In the Optical regime this can represent the effective wavelength, for instance.

objectType.name: Flux
objectType.description: This class is used to characterize the photometric calibration Flux<—> Magnitude associated to the ZeroPoint used by a PhotCal instance.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: Unified Content Description (UCD) string that specifies the nature of the flux.

attribute.name: unitexpression
attribute.description: Unit string that specifies the flux unit.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: A flux value.

attribute.name: error
attribute.description: Flux value error corresponding to the reference magnitude value of the calibrating object.
